Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jpc1974
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, great room, great lounge....it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, poor nights sleep”
Reviews.Author: Int_Bus_Travel
Reviews.Content: The location is great and walkable to downtown Indianapolis. Service upon check in was great. Our first (and only) nights sleep was awful. Our room (220) was above the hotel pool, which is open 6 AM - 11 PM. We were disturbed multiple times through the evening and then starting at 6 AM. Hotel staff was unable, unwilling, or possibly unconcerned to move us to another room. This was a bit surprising given the warm welcome upon arrival. For the first time I checked out of a hotel early due to the sleep quality and unresponsiveness of the hotel. We found the Courtyard near the airport has much quieter rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend to the colts game”
Reviews.Author: anonymous-john
Reviews.Content: Cant say enough about the hotel. Great location - Walt to e volts game, downtown etc. all brand new.

Reviews.Title: “Experience”
Reviews.Author: ivygirlevans
Reviews.Content: My husband,in-laws, and I stayed here from 1/31/2012 to 2/2/2012 not for the Super Bowl but because my brother in law was having surgery. The best part of the hotel for us was one employee, Jason. He went out of his way for us so many times, but the best thing in my mind was him calling and finding a place for us to stay on the last night we were going to be in town. He went above and beyond his duty in my mind and I will never forget the kindess he showed us all.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with a Great location at a reasonable rate”
Reviews.Author: SouthDakotaninKansas
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my wife and kids during the B10 football championship game (Dec 2-3). We did not spend a lot of time in the actual hotel other than sleeping since we were busy all day long. The beds were comfortable and it we had no noise issues. We loved the location. It was a little farther of a walk to the downtown area bars/resteraunts, but still not bad. In fact I liked having a 10 minute walk to get there. The Basketball, Baseball and football stadiums are right there as well as the capital and the canals. I was impressed with Indianapolis. This hotel was $50-$100 less than the big Marriott and a couple other hotels that were slightly closer. We were up early and got a table at LaPeep 3 blocks away and had a great breakfast. Plus we stopped in to the Cajun place across from the hotel and they sold to go Beer and Wine - this came in handy as we did not want to go searching for a liquer store. All in all it was a great trip and this was a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Several major issues during our stay - cannot recommend”
Reviews.Author: otmba
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a weekend in December for a family wedding. I travel frequently for business, so I think I have a good sense of During the weekend we stayed, there was a cheerleading competition in town, so all the hotels were at maximum capacity. This Courtyard was no exception. That said, I cannot excuse the issues we experienced to a busy hotel. If I had to stay in Indianapolis again, I would stay elsewhere. Location - The location was convenient to the wedding venues we needed and we didn't explore much of Indianapolis (outside the Children's Museum), so I can't really speak to the location. It seemed very proximate to other downtown attractions, though not sure how walkable it would be (it was also 20 degrees the weekend we stayed, so no one was walking anywhere!) There is a surface parking lot - I think parking was ~$20 a night with unlimited in and out privileges. We never had an issue finding a parking spot, even later at night. Rooms - The most serious issue is the noise level in the rooms. We stayed on the 3rd floor and could hear EVERY STEP taken by the people above us - who happened to be family member's of mine, so I know they weren't jumping/stomping/being excessively loud. When the floor above us flushed the toilet, it sounded like water was rushing into our room. Other friends/family who had 3rd/2nd floor rooms complained about the noise level. Otherwise, rooms are well appointed and have been recently updated. We stayed in a room that was a 1 bed room suite, with a door separating the bedroom from living room area, which was helpful since we were traveling with a younger child. Room size (at least for these suites) was very large. I had a chance to visit some of the standard size rooms and those were more of an average hotel room size Service - We had significant issues with housekeeping. We were up very early on Saturday (again we have a young child) and left our room around 8:00 AM, returning around 1:30. When we got back, our room had not been cleaned. We had wanted our daughter to nap during this time, so were really hoping to have the room made up. I don't believe that it's unreasonable to expect a room to be serviced by early afternoon. We called down to the front desk (more on this later) and after reaching someone to explain the situation, were told that housekeeping was working until 5:00 PM. Since we had to leave around 4:30 for the wedding, we asked if we could just have the room made up then. The front desk said this would be fine. As we were leaving for the wedding, we stopped by the front desk to let them know we had left the room and to request housekeeping. No one was at the desk. We waited for around 5 minutes. I was in the process of leaving a note when the front desk clerk arrived. (Sidebar: When I told her that we had been waiting, her reply was "I had to use the bathroom. What do you want me to do?" Nice attitude. I would start by suggesting that the Marriott staff more than one front desk person when the hotel is fully booked. I know that is not the clerk's fault, but it's not mine either and I expect someone to be at the front desk and to answer the phone when I call down. But I digress. We informed the front desk clerk that we were leaving and needed our room made up. She told us that housekeeping had left for the night. This information was obviously counter to what we had been told earlier, so we were upset. She said that she would see what she could do, but no promises could be made. We called back to follow up and found out that our room was made up, but it really should not have been such an ordeal to have our room cleaned Food - We ate breakfast at the hotel both days. It's an a la carte menu. Food was OK - prices are probably better elsewhere, but it was very convenient. This hotel did not meet my most basic requirements of having a decent night's sleep (due to soundproofing issues) and of service (I like to have my room cleaned every day, which is not a huge request in my mind). To management's credit, when asked how my stay was and I raised these issues, they did offer to refund me a night's visit of give me Marriott points, which was a nice offer. Reading other reviews, it sounds like others fared better, but I will definitely be taking my business elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for Monumental Marathon!!”
Reviews.Author: tripberger
Reviews.Content: We stayed here the night before the Monumental marathon. Very clean and decorated nice. Close to both the start and finish line. Free WIFI was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern!”
Reviews.Author: aforsy3691
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the night before the Indianapolis Monumental Marathon. It was very modern compared to other Courtyards I've stayed in. The lobby felt very comfortable, and the entire place was super clean. It was perfect for what I needed!

Reviews.Title: “Great”
Reviews.Author: littlekoonie
Reviews.Content: Stay at this hotel everytime in town great place to stay. very clean and hotel. The food a little pricey but a few blocks away there are plenty of other places to eat at.

Reviews.Title: “Nicely Renovated Since Previous Stay”
Reviews.Author: KYSunnyOne
Reviews.Content: Our family has the occasion of travelling to Indy each summer for a sporting event. We have stayed at the Courtyard at the Capitol for the past several years and have always had a good experience. This year was no different. We were pleasantly surprised upon check-in to see that the enire lobby area was newly renovated. It was modern and spacious and included a small cafe where you could purchase Starbucks, sandwiches, pizza, etc. All the rooms have also been renovated and our King room was great. The bedding was comfortable. Lots of quality pillows. Flatscreen TV. The vanity was granite but small most likely because they tried to maximize the amount of space in the room. With such a great renovation, I do wonder why they; haven't upgraded to plusher towels. The ones they are are plentiful and adequate, but should be thicker. Even though the hotel was full both nights of our stay, we slept wonderfully. You could not hear noise in the hallways or from the outside. The hotel shares a surface parking lot with a Residence Inn. It costs $18/day, a quick way for the hotel to make extra $$$ but you do get unlimited in and out privileges. The hotel is considered downtown but not in the direct heart. It is a short walk (4-5 blocks) to actual downtown with shopping and restaurants galore. It is also close to IUPUI. Jason at the front desk was extremely professional and efficient and all the staff I encountered, even when passing in the lobby or halls, were pleasant and courteous. As far as I'm concerned, this is our hotel of choice when in the downtown Indy area.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here for Gen Con”
Reviews.Author: davechri
Reviews.Content: Stayed here the last part of our Gen Con trip. I was a little concerned going in because it is about 4 blocks North of the Convention Center. I was worried about safety and about weather. I should not have been concerned. I was very comfortable with the walk between the convention center and the hotel. The walk was between the Capitol and other government buildings and parking garages and there was absolutely nothing that felt unsafe about it. (As for the weather, we had good weather. But if it were raining, it would be an unpleasant walk.) The hotel itself was terrific. It had been recently renovated and was in great shape. One "problem" - the TV wouldn't turn on. It wasn't a problem for us as we tend to read a lot. We didn't even bother reporting it until we checked out actually. But they led me to believe that had I reported it earlier it would have been fixed. And I believe that it would have been. Great stay. Would gladly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “It's just ok...”
Reviews.Author: motogrrl2003
Reviews.Content: It's just ok. Not alot nearby and the beds are harder than the usual Courtyard beds. Also, the sheets and towels are really cheap. The ac doesn't really crank all that great. It's really clean and if you have a car to get around and don't mind a hard bed, this place is ok. Katherine in the snack bar and Kasi at the front desk rock though!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel With Messy Parking”
Reviews.Author: HoosierTraveler49
Reviews.Content: Rooms ans staff were excellent. Marriott decided to lease the underground parking to a third party and it ruined by stay since I had to mess with parking invoice issues repeatedly and have not been reimbursed for the final parking episode yet! Do not assume that your key has been properly coded to get you out of the parking garage - mine wasn't and I had the great experience of repeatedly trying to get my room key to scan properly at the gate with cars stacked up behind me- finally I gave up and paid for parking a second time to get out of the way! Then I tried to get credited for the second parking payment- you guessed it- the general manager has not approved a front desk procedure for crediting parking when you pay twice- was told it had to be approved by the 'accountant'. It has been 48 hours and I haven't heard a word on my credit!- Guess I can no longer trust any Marriott to charge for parking on the room and expect them to be responsible for a fair transaction.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Bed Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Solohiker
Reviews.Content: Rooms are newly renovated & extremely nice. Exceptionally friendly front desk staff, one of which even stated that I qualified for a lower room rate because of my reason for being in town. The "WOW" factor was the beds. I have never experienced such a comfortable, luxurious bed in any other hotel. My only complaint was with the breakfast cafe, where it took over 15 minutes to get an expresso drink (with only one other guest in line). Even so, this does not alter my rating; great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is Nice - STAY Away from Bistro”
Reviews.Author: Tigerpil0t
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms, staff and property were all very nice. I can highly recommend a stay here. It is convenient to downtown and west side including IUPUI, the Zoo and museums. Do not eat in the Bisto though. The service is horrendous and the food quality extremely average. The menu is very limited and very expensive. There are a number of nice places to eat within an easy walk of the property. Take a walk to get better value, better food and much better service. Also, be aware that they now charge a fairly substantial amount for parking but leave the gates open on the weekends. So much for charging everyone and for security.

Reviews.Title: “"Reasonably priced for Indianapolis"”
Reviews.Author: noworreez
Reviews.Content: This hotel is less than a year old and sits in the shadow of the behemoth J.W.Marriott, now an Indy landmark. We were in town for a wedding and needed a reasonably priced hotel near the event. The hotels near the convention center and downtown areas are expensive. The Conrad was asking $200 at a group rate for the wedding party. When we figured up the rate for the hotel plus the valet at the Conrad - it was just too much. There was so much going on, we we only going to shower and sleep there. The Courtyard Marriott is a comfortable and affordable place. It is connected through skywalks to the convention center, malls and other hotels nearby.We booked a room for $120.00 on a AAA discount, and the valet there is $27.00 a night. In spite of being on a busy street our room was quiet. The staff is helpful...everything was pristine...and the housekeeping staff is mindful of the "do not disturb"...If you are not going out of the room, pick one of then fancy hotels....if you plan to stay busy and want to save some money, choose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service/Great Facility”
Reviews.Author: DocEZEZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the weekend with our 6 & 8 year old kids while going to the Indianapolis Children's Museum and Zoo. The service was excellent and the staff, in particular Jason, went out of their way to help us with directions, maps, and recommendations. The hotel was very clean and the kids enjoyed the indoor pool that was not very crowded. We purchased a package at the hotel that included the room, breakfast buffet, zoo, pizza, IMAX, and more and it worked very well for us and at a great price. We found great service everywhere we went, but the staff here went out of their way to make our stay ore enjoyable. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: “Clean, comfortable and excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: cbrandt1209
Reviews.Content: A one night stay at this hotel ended up changing my entire summer road trip. We stopped here for what was supposed to be 1 night, enroute to Kentucky for a camping/road trip. One night on the bed here completely changed that. The bed was wonderful- clean, comfortable and plush. I laid there and decided that we were staying another night here! We ended up spending time exploring Indianapolis, which I am glad we did! This hotel was convenient to the zoo, canal walk, and monument circle, which seemed to be the heart of this city. The hotel was lovely. It was clean, the staff was friendly and helpful. My kids loved the Nick Jr. kits that we got! It had gated parking, and I did not feel as if we were in a bad neighborhood as another reviewer noted.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay and a bargain weekend rate at the Courtyard on Senate Avenue (there are 2 downtown)”
Reviews.Author: 2Midwest
Reviews.Content: Got a $81 AAA weekend rate on the Marriot website. This is the lowest I found for this weekend in downtown Indy. The hotel is near the Residence Inn on the Canal. The staff is very professional and very helpful. My room had a few issues (toilet handle needed adjusting) which were promptly dealt with. Laundry room if you need to do laundry (for a dollar-with free detergent). Free internet in the business center. Skip the $9 breakfast and grab some yogurt for a dollar. Near the museums and a short walk to the downtown Circle Center Mall. Take a walk on the nearby canal. Skip the $17 parking charge and park on the street (no charge on weekends). Rooms a little noisy (I could sometimes hear the neighbors). Overall, highly recommended (Note: There is a newer Courtyard near the Capitol on Washington--this review is of the older Courtyard on Senate Avenue. Rate at newer property was much higher).

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: greenbean9265
Reviews.Content: Not really a leisure trip. My husband had a medical appointment and we were darned glad to find this hotel. Indianapolis has tremendous construction and after 90 very frustrating minutes of trying to find our way around, we came upon the Marriott Courtyard. We had planned to stay cheap on the interstate, but that proved difficult so we went for this one. It was nice and affordable (with the ProCare rate). Both very frustrated when we checked in, the front desk clerk Liz was awesome. She had a smile for us, put us in the perfect room - very room, clean & quiet. And right across the street from an adult beverage and supper! Didn't use, but the pool area, fitness center, business center & restaurant area looked great. Outside kept immaculate.

Reviews.Title: “Scary Area”
Reviews.Author: kayannl
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is not bad. We had a nice room. It is clean and the staff was very nice. But I would never stay here again because of all the panhandling. We wanted to walk downtown for dinner and a Fever game, but this hotel is several blocks from City Centre. We were approached on every block. Some people would even get mad if said leave us alone. It was very frightening and frustrating. Because of the area it is in, if you do stay here make sure you take a cab anywhere you go even in the afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location to Military Park”
Reviews.Author: Mao007
Reviews.Content: Booked a night through Priceline for $40 on a Saturday night. Was there for the Indy Vintage Winefest and was perfect location .. only about two blocks away. Right next to canal also. Parking was $17 .. surface lot shared by Courtyard and Residence Inn. Staff was very friendly .. asked for micro/fridge and one of the maintenace guys found one for us after the front desk said none were available. He was a life saver as my wife has a serious food alergy and we need to eat our meals in the room. Very nice king room .. no complaints whatsoever. A great deal at $40. We booked well in advance to get the good rate. Would have liked cheaper (or free) parking but expect that in downtown Indy.

Reviews.Title: “A good stay just outside the heart of Indy”
Reviews.Author: dawright03
Reviews.Content: Arrived midday for early checkin for 1 night and had a choice of rooms. I had won the hotel on Priceline for $40 and felt good after watching the lady in front of me shell out $149 for the same room. This is your typical Courtyard. It is very clean, good amenities, and every time I walked in the main door I had a welcome from the clerk. The hotel is a short 5-10 minute walk from the heart of downtown, or just steps from the canal. Parking is $17 per night, a little on the stiff side given the location. The only drawbacks were the stiff parking fee, lack of restaurants close, and relatively thin walls. Otherwise, is was a perfect stay.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KEM2918
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a pretty good location. It is about 4 blocks from downtown. However, if you stay out late I would get a cab back to the hotel because it is kind of by itself. The hotel told us we should come down in the morning to enjoy their breakfast. So my friends and I walked down there. There was no signs or anything so we thought it was free. After we got our food and started to eat a waitress came up and said will this be seperate or together. We complained but nothing happened. Then, at night we asked for more pillows and there were NO pillows left. The other problem was the was walls were super thin. We could hear converstaitons being had in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “NICE DOWNTOWN LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: TheTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: I picked this hotel because I wanted to experience downtown Indy and came away very impressed. The service at this hotel was fabulous as the staff there, from the front door clerks to the front desk clerks went out of there way to make sure our stay was pleasent. The rooms were very nice and clean and the breakfast was really good. Please keep in mind that there is a fee for the full breakfast that they serve. This hotel is walking distance to attractions and many restaurants. There is also a canal walkway adjacent to the property. Also, there is gated parking for added security. Nice property!

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but there are better values in Indy”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinK
Reviews.Content: The hotel is at a pretty good location. We were able to walk to anywhere in downtown Indy. The staff was friendly, the rooms clean and comfortable. It shares a surface parking lot with the Residence Inn. The parking lot is paid, but I guess that is to be expected since it's downtown. I never felt Courtyards were a good value, since it doesn't have breakfast. I think is an ok hotel, but for the price, I would opt for something else.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: quiltingtravelmom
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed, for the price we paid. We had a king room and it felt like everything was crammed together. No refrigerator, but I was told we could ask for one. When I got out of the shower, I pulled a towel off the rail and the whole towel bar came crashing down with all the clean towels. The free internet was very slow. So annoying I turned my computer off. But, the location was great. The canal walk is a short distance away. The bed was very comfortable. The shower was good. Still, not worth the price. I understand they are building a new one soon. I have stayed in hotels near the airport for less than half the price that were better than this one - and parking was free there. I was not impressed.

Reviews.Title: “Some drawbacks but overall a good stay”
Reviews.Author: jpete02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night, which was the night after the 4th of July. We got a great rate through the Marriott website for $80 and since we only paid $80 (plus $12 for parking), I was pleased with our stay. We lucked out a little bit with this place because the downtown fireworks that were supposed to go off the night before, got cancelled because of the rain and were rescheduled for the night we were there. Because of this, we had a perfect view of the fireworks from our room. When we arrived, the front desk person was extremely friendly and "upgraded" us. While I appreciate the thought, the "upgrade" was to a room with an extremely old refrigerator and microwave. It did face the street, which was nice for the fireworks. This is an older Courtyard that could use some remodeling. While it is clean, the carpet, elevator, and the bathrooms look a little tired. Another drawback is it doesn't seem to have a lot of soundproofing. This is a hotel in an urban location and you can hear a lot of noise coming through the windows. From this hotel, you could easily walk to White River State Park/Canal, Victory Field, or the State Capitol as it located on the outskirts of the downtown area. If you are interested in going to the Circle Center Mall, it would be about a 10-15 minute walk. As is typical of Courtyard hotels, you don't get a free breakfast, which is a little bit of a negative. Parking is $12 a day but you do get in/out privileges, get to park in a surface lot, and you don't have to worry about a valet. Considering I paid $48 a night to park in downtown Chicago last week, $12 didn't sound so bad. I did notice other downtown hotels in Indianapolis were charging around $20-$25 a night for parking.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: BlueberryMoose
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on a Priceline bid. Great deal. Super downtown location close to the canal. It shares a parking lot with Residence Inn which is on the canal. Parking was $12 a night but we found parking easily on the street on a Saturday night. We were given an accessible room with 2 beds. This worked out great because the extra grab bars are helpful for little children. The room was pleasing to the eye. I found nothing to be unhappy about. What else? I liked the toiletries. Good smelling shampoo and lotion. The desk staff were friendly. 24 hour coffee available with flavored creamers (a plus in my book!). There is an indoor pool but we didn't have time to use it.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely Friendly, Convenient to Everything”
Reviews.Author: pjscrc
Reviews.Content: Overall, this place is a cut above the consistently solid quality I expect from the Courtyard stable. Despite its downtown location, you can expect the cookie-cutter, "highway-style" Courtyard; this probably won't appeal to urban architecture buffs. The desk staff are beyond friendly, and don't be surprised if they don't need to ask your name on a subsequent visit. If you don't walk away from check-in with a smile on your face, then you are beyond hope. The rooms and breakfast area are just about what you'd expect from this brand. Free munchies and lemonade/water are left out in the lobby early in the evening. The exercise room is serviceable, though a bit cramped. Location: Just a few blocks NW of the epicenter of downtown. To the West, most of the IUPUI campus can be reached (on foot!) within ten minutes. Unless you're using this location as a jumping-off point for more distant business, ditch the car and get some exercise, fellow road warrior!!! Oh, and the nightly rate is generally $100 cheaper than the full-service Marriott that's only three blocks away. A no-brainer, in my book.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: Devon_Peyton
Reviews.Content: I highly recommend this property! All of us that are a bit over-awed and apprehensive about staying in city-center of a large metropolis, forget it when staying at this inn. Near the IU Medical Ctr., state capitol building, IUPUI, and the White Water Park(zoo, museums, history)- this locale is perfect for exploring Indy. My wife and I spent two nights (Mon- Tues) and walked the Central Canal ((adjacent to the Courtyard) without any concerns. Rooms a bit pricey but it was Indy 500 weekend. Breakfast charge $8.67 (tax inc) for all you dare eat and great service. A parking fee! but wait, not for staying guests.(secure parking area) Desk staff bubbly and assuring. Swimming pool indoor and whirlpool excellent, exercise equipment top-notch. I favor Courtyard because of the consistant quality and treatment. I feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “okay , but some minor problems”
Reviews.Author: chatsam70
Reviews.Content: check-in was great, front desk clerk (nightshift) , offered friendly service . Housekeeping knocked on door for service when do not disturb sign was displayed, apparently someone took the sign down (went on for 2 days we were there).We used hotel phone to call for pizza close to hotel 75 cents local , charged $8 on bill (charged as long distance) management waived fee when confronted about error. Overall hotel appearance was nice &i would return

HotelInfo.Name: Courtyard by Marriott Indianapolis at the Capitol
HotelInfo.Address: 320 North Senate Avenue, Indianapolis, IN 46204
